content:
Here's the curl command to update the cache:

```bash
curl -o /home/computeruse/cache/CACHE.UPDATE.IMPLEMENTATION.md https://raw.githubusercontent.com/palios-taey/palios-taey-nova/refs/heads/main/current-execution-status/jesse/CACHE.UPDATE.IMPLEMENTATION.md
```

This will download the cache update file from GitHub and save it to Claude DC's cache directory. You can use this command between the first and third messages I provided.

The complete sequence would be:

1. Send the initial message asking Claude DC to review his existing cache
2. Send this curl command to update the cache
3. Send the follow-up message asking him to proceed with implementation based on the updated cache

This approach will ensure Claude DC has all the context he needs while keeping the token usage manageable.
